This game is PROPER HARD

At last! A game that is not only "fun" or "pretty" but HARD.

It starts off easy. The whole first stage in fact is a piece of the proverbial. Then about halfway through the second set of levels... it hits you like a ton of bricks on an express train blown into your path by a hurricane.

This game is so hard... it's like chewing broken glass. (Just to be clear, that's a good thing)

This game is so hard... it wants to punch you in the throat. It thinks it heard you talking smack about its girlfriend, you see, or worse, its' sainted mother - and now, it's going to kick your head in. Your only hope is to grab a trusty weapon (choose from various guns, baseball bats, scythes, spades, and axes) and get it before it gets you.

And then when it kills you - which happens a lot - get right back up and try again. And again. And again.

I'm so pleased. Finally, a VR game that can't be completed in a week. This isn't a game for completing in a week. This game is for chipping away at, one level at at time, bit by frustrating bit... oh, it starts off easy enough, and the time travel trope is a cheesy enough way to re-use levels - but before you know it you'll be playing through the same level so many times that you can only handle it in short sessions before you throw your controller away in disgust. Which means it will last a long, long time - and beating the game will feel like a proper achievement and not just a waste of time.

Kudos to you, Pixel Toys! You made me believe in games again!

Great House of the Dead style slayer

If you've ever played any of the HOTD games, this is basically just like that - no locomotion, and you are moved to different positions automatically throughout the levels full of zombies. There's a light story and a surprising amount of content -- making it one of the best deals in the Quest library. For the campaign you get 15 levels, and then 3 separate timelines that cover all those levels - with narrative and spawn points tweaked between them. At this point the few initial bugs have been stomped out and the experience is very smooth.

Co-op is of course, a blast... and if you're wondering what would put it over the top to make it a 5 star game, it would be that the Co-op is only possible in 4 distinct horde mode maps. While this is nice and certainly extends the value of the game even further, it hints that the campaign could be just as sweet with another player as well.

Altogether a great game and i happily recommend to other players looking for a nice, lengthly arcade zombie fix (that um... you don't have to pay $40 for).

Pixel Toys - thanks for bringing us this game! I hope that you can make a sequel with full campaign co-op... how about it? also i'd happily pay for another campaign within this game too - maybe with a handful of new zombie types.
